context_of_use: This use case allows admins to manage user accounts, products, pricing, and inventory levels in the system.
stakeholders_and_interests: admin: control system access and manage product availability
description: This use case enables admins to manage user accounts, create products, update product prices, and manage inventory levels.
preconditions: Admin is logged into the system.
postconditions: User accounts, products, pricing, and inventory levels are updated as per admin actions.
assumptions: Admin has the necessary permissions to manage catalog.
requirements_met: The system shall allow admins to manage user accounts.
The system shall allow admins to create new products.
The system shall allow admins to update product prices.
The system shall allow admins to manage inventory levels.
main_flow: 1. Admin selects the option to manage user accounts → System displays user account management interface.
2. Admin updates user account details → System saves the updated user account information.
3. Admin selects the option to create new products → System displays product creation interface.
4. Admin enters product details and submits → System creates the new product.
5. Admin selects the option to update product prices → System displays pricing update interface.
6. Admin updates product prices and submits → System saves the updated pricing information.
7. Admin selects the option to manage inventory levels → System displays inventory management interface.
8. Admin updates inventory levels and submits → System saves the updated inventory information.
